results.title: Some have magnetic properties
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
In this film a teacher gives egg cartons filled with magnets to the children, encouraging them to discover which have magnetic properties. Various children explore contacts with iron filings, a compass, paper clips, and numerous other objects. Freedom not to be involved is open to the children here, but they are on the whole, quite involved in the project.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation

results.title: Sir, you forgot to pay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Experience with numbers, dramatic play and concept formation are among the aims behind conducting a store in a classroom situation. Activities include experiment with barter, use of an adding machine and cash register, and the purchase of merchandise. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Playground
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
The playground provides an opportunity for the child to develop his motor skills. Children are seen in this environment responding to the challenges of obstacles and play things.

results.title: Marcia is here
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
To start the afternoon at kindergarten children here are encouraged to move about freely without adult intervention in the classroom in order to unwind and release tension. Some of the activities involve playing with hoops, bouncing balls, and hop-scotch. The teacher checks attendance by having the children select the letters of their name and form an appropriate sentence such as “Marica is here”. Freedom of activity is encouraged in the afternoon program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation

results.title: I'll play my guitar softly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Kindergarten children are observed here responding to the rhythm of music. The teacher, while playing a guitar, encourages different responses at different times, sometimes the rhythmic cadence of sticks and sometimes a vocal response. At the conclusion the children disperse in an orderly way for refreshment and “quiet time”.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A child is assisted by the teacher to clarify her feelings about another child sho is engaged in an independent activity. The child’s inappropriate criticism is mildly reprimanded.

results.title: How many members in a set
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are presented with a variety of materials through which to learn mathematical concepts. The teacher invites several children to group small toy cars into various sets and endeavours to lead them to the abstract notion of members of a set. From here the film then moves around the class and observes the activities of other children with the material offered them.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Kindergarten children are seen writing, illustrating and reading their own stories.
